Reason: The configuration _journalDiskSync is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts system performance by determining whether disk synchronization is used for the journal. Enabling disk synchronization can introduce latency and overhead depending on the frequency of disk writes, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the configuration is tied to the creation of a PersistentJournal object with the specified _journalDiskSync value, indicating that it involves time-expensive and memory-expensive operations within its related code.
